Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2007 01:15AM snherrington wrote: Jodi, I was diagnosed in 2004 with IDC Stage 5 and her2neu positive.  I had 5cm tumor in my left breast and positive lymphnodes. 6 out of 11. I underwent a radical double mascectomy.  I also had 8 liver mets.  I went through 6 months of chemo.  I received chemo every 3 weeks with weekly Herceptin treatments.  I have been in remission for 2 years and I have just had reconstruction surgery 2 weeks ago.  Due to the fact that I am Her2neu positive my oncologist has recommended that I receive Herceptin treatments every 3 weeks for the rest of my life.  I also have Pet Scans, MRI's and LV Gaited(heart test) every 3 months.  You will have days that you all you want to do is cry and that is okay but remember I am living proof that medicine has come a long way.  Make sure that you are very comfortable with your oncologist and that they shoot straight with you and that they are agresssive.  Your oncologist choice will be a lifelong relationship.  Her2neu positive can be very agressive but the good thing about it... is that most women respond quickly to chemo.   My tumor marker was 235 at first diagnosis and it dropped to 88 after my first chemo.  I will be keeping you in my thoughts and prayers.  You will do great and you will find that you are alot stronger than you ever thought you could be.  We find a strength in us that we did not know existed, especially if we have children, and I have 3.  They were my strength, and I was determined that my children were going to have a mother.  Yes the every 3 weeks get aggrivating after 3 years of doing it... but it is a small sacrifice to see my children grow up.  God Bless You!
